1.153-.415 1.153s-1.273-2.26-1.758-1.637c-.486.622-.532 1.014-.347 1.176.185.16 1.55 1.314 1.596 1.798.047.484.163 2.86.047 2.86s-1.735-3.183-2.105-2.998c-.37.184-.463 1.383-.416 1.522.046.138 2.082 3.02 2.105 3.39.024.368 0 2.074-.092 2.005-.093-.07-2.29-3.988-2.5-3.896-.207.092-.647.83-.6 1.107.045.277 3.238 5.026 3.26 5.256.024.23 0 2.86-.207 2.86s-2.775-5.21-2.96-5.21c-.186 0-.81.99-.74 1.29.068.3 3.562 5.625 3.655 5.994.093.37.116 3.158 0 3.158s-3.68-7.285-3.91-7.285c-.23 0-.88.945-.833 1.037.046.092 3.84 6.64 3.84 6.94 0 .3-.092.368-.092.368s-.278.092-.347-.023c-.07-.116-3.077-5.004-3.355-5.073-.278-.07-.995.715-.833.945.162.23 3.124 4.035 3.008 4.196-.116.16-1.458.092-1.596 0-.14-.092-2.314-3.965-2.568-3.92-.255.047-.88.946-.834 1.06.046.116 2.13 2.93 2.106 2.998-.023.07-1.18.138-1.296.023-.116-.116-1.92-2.952-2.36-2.998-.44-.046-.717.922-.578 1.037.14.114 1.69 2.143 1.41 2.143-.277 0-2.313.138-2.36-.37-.045-.506.394-10.374.37-13.647-.022-3.274-.346-17.29-.184-18.052.034-.16 6.502-.023 7.59-.046 1.086-.023 1.78.023 1.873.16s-.046 5.396.324 5.58c.37.184 1.366-.807 2.168-.163-.046-2.083-4.772-2.615-4.657-.536.116-.675 1.337-.56 1.522zm-26.098-6.294c-.37-.23-4.373-.16-4.65-.16-.28 0-.44.483-.394.668 0 0-.093.553.093.807s3.425.138 3.772.138.393 1.707.44 2.053c.046.346 1.18.092 1.342.07.162-.024.162-.554.162-1.315s-.394-2.03-.764-2.26zm13.304 1.96c-.347.207-.44 1.014.162 1.268s3.24.83 4.627 1.937c1.388 1.107 1.435 4.288 1.458 4.61.023.324.95.577 1.365.116.416-.462.23-2.72-1.273-5.327-1.504-2.605-6.08-2.76-6.34-2.605z" />
        </svg></a></li> 
      <li><a href="mailto:georgethomaslambert@gmail.com?subject=Introduction" target="_blank">
        <svg class="icon odd" enable-background="new 0 0 64 64" viewbox="0 0 64 64" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
         <path d="M63.93 41.12c.068-3.195-.727-27.102-.866-29.266s-4.08-2.817-6.156-2.85-7.02.205-7.92.205c-.898 0-10.65-.07-17.463 0s-22.097.24-24.864.24-5.626.35-5.982.824C-.74 12.164.505 24.872.505 33.528S.92 46.993 1.3 48.195c.38 1.202 1.903 4.5 2.456 5.015s1.59.447 5.637.515c4.046.07 4.392.275 13.97.275s19.47-.31 27.91-.55 9.232-.378 11.273-1.786c2.04-1.408 1.314-7.35 1.383-10.545zM62.44 29.474c-.242-.275-2.144-3.126-2.524-3.09-.38.033-.31.755-.242 1.098.07.343 2.628 3.09 2.628 3.297s.173 2.027.07 1.958c-.105-.07-2.007-3.572-2.456-3.366-.45.206-.45.996-.415 1.27.035.276 2.836 3.264 6.63.035.447-.52.962-.795.824s-4.22-6.595-4.807-7.454c-.588-.86-.83-.86-1.14-.48-.312.377.414 1.064.933 1.957.52.893 3.217 5.152 3.598 7.607 2.473 2.248.07 4.842-.893 7.02-2.473 2.18-1.58 3.354-2.404 3.7-2.37.346.034 3.147 3.916 3.77 5.015.622 1.1.76 1.614.553 1.82zm-32.23-15.25c-2.25-2.165-7.8-6.88-8.404-6.87-2.627.033-1.832 4.052-1.66 9.273.174 5.22.97 11.92 1.384 13.705.415 1.786 1.73 1.82 2.8 1.546s1.903-1.683 4.013-4.328c2.11-2.645 5.187-6.904 5.464-8.76s-1.348-2.403-3.596-4.567zM12.4 40.053c-.934 1.134-.83 1.168-1.072 1.134-.242-.034 0-10.408-.104-12.33s-.31-4.088-.138-4.466c.115-.252 3.25 2.44 4.945 3.847 1.695 1.407 2.594 2.197 2.663 2.54.07.344-5.36 8.14-6.294 9.274zm22.547-8.07c-1.696.274-3.502-.295-3.943-.38-.726-.136-.865.757-.415 1.17.45.41 1.418.686 3.977.652 2.558-.034 4.287-1.03 4.564-1.477.277-.448-.138-1.1-.622-1.17-.485-.068-1.868.928-3.563 1.203zM6.28 47.095c-.38-.343 0-2.645-.206-3.023-.207-.378-1.192-.356-1.35 0-.24.55-.172 2.336.105 3.297s1.002 1.546 1.97 1.408.934-1.065.83-1.305c-.104-.24-.97-.034-1.35-.377zM4.83 15.186c.207-.824 1.556-.79 1.937-.996.38-.206.45-.137.38-.584-.07-.447-.52-.927-1.902-.687s-2.075 1.476-2.04 2.54c.035 1.066-.048 3.355.277 3.54.484.274 1.037.274 1.245.033s-.104-3.023.103-3.847zm55.16-1.065c.24-.308.414-.55-.45-1.82s-2.78-1.623-3.113-1.442c-1.072.584-.484 1.786.52 1.82 1.002.034 1.486 1.27 1.832 1.683s.968.07 1.21-.24z" />
        </svg></a></li> 
      <li><a href="/find-me">
        <svg class="icon even" enable-background="new 0 0 64 64" viewbox="0 0 64 64" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
         <path d="M43.743 2.27c-7.1-3.264-14.475-2.89-20.93.372-6.453 3.263-8.734 7.84-9.772 11.095-2.764 8.67.463 14.918 4.06 22.842 3.595 7.923 12.54 27.13 15.12 27.41 2.58.28 4.886-5.5 8.573-12.68 3.688-7.18 10.88-21.725 11.986-29.65 1.106-7.924-1.937-16.13-9.036-19.39zm7.606 19.718c-.486-.28-7.4-8.6-7.816-8.67-.415-.07-1.106.07-.622.488.484.42 8.02 9.02 8.02 9.51s-.345 2.517-.69 2.238c-.346-.28-6.57-8.95-7.19-9.02-.623-.07-.83.77-.416 1.12s6.915 8.67 6.915 9.09.07 1.258-.276 1.188c-.346-.07-6.154-8.32-6.846-8.11-.692.21-.623.628-.416 1.048s6.638 8.18 6.638 8.18-.553 1.96-.968 1.82c-.415-.14-5.255-7.203-5.878-7.203s-1.176.42-.69 1.05c.483.628 6.015 7.27 5.946 7.62-.07.35-1.245 3.357-1.452 3.008-.207-.35-5.324-8.67-5.878-8.74-.553-.07-.69.07-.415.768.277.7 5.878 8.04 5.947 8.67s-.207 1.82-.69 1.4c-.485-.42-5.74-8.18-6.294-8.32-.553-.14-1.037.07-.622.628.415.56 6.43 8.113 6.223 8.533-.207.42-.277 2.168-.62 1.678-.348-.49-5.465-8.11-5.95-8.11s-1.244.42-.69.91c.553.49 6.154 7.76 6.016 8.11s-.622 2.17-1.037 1.75c-.416-.42-4.703-6.715-5.256-6.855-.553-.14-1.106.28-.69.98.414.698 5.53 6.502 5.323 6.922-.207.42.138 2.238-.83 1.468s-4.495-6.014-5.255-6.014c-.76 0-1.106.56-.69 1.12.414.56 5.116 6.293 5.116 6.293s-.485 1.468-.692 1.26-4.218-6.154-4.91-6.224-.968.21-.76.63c.206.42 4.978 5.942 4.91 6.5-.07.56-.07 2.798-.762 1.96s-4.08-4.896-4.495-4.826c-.415.07-.9.14-.484.84.415.698 4.287 4.544 4.15 5.034-.14.49-.554 1.33-.83 1.26-.278-.07-3.182-4.197-3.735-4.057-.552.14-.62.28-.483.84.138.56 3.596 3.916 3.457 1.47-.968 3.357-2.835 3.916z" />
        </svg></a></li> 
     </ul> 
     <div class="clearfix"></div> 
     <hr> 
     <h2>Client Side Sentiment Analysis with Sentimood.js</h2> 
     <span class="date">06 Jul 2016</span> 
    </div> 
   </header> 
   <hr> 
   <div class=" row main-content"> 
    <p>There are several NodeJS modules out there which can be used to perform sentiment analysis on text, including <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/sentiment">sentiment</a>, <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/Sentimental">sentimental</a>, <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/sentiment-alyze">sentiment-alyze</a> and <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/sentiword">sentiword</a>. Of course, all of these packages have to be used on the server side.</p> 
    <p>I recently found myself wanting to use sentiment analysis on the client side, and so went searching for a browser-based sentiment analysis package. There isn't too much out there, but I did come across an excellent browser-based package called <a href="https://github.com/soops/sentimood">Sentimood.js</a>. According to the GitHub <code>readme.md</code> file, it is effectively the same as the NodeJS <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/Sentimental">sentimental</a> package, but edited/translated for browser-side use.</p> 
    <h4>Setup</h4> 
    <p>Sentimood is incredibly easy to use. You can use <code>bower</code> to install the package with <code>bower install sentimood</code>. Alternatively, just copy the <code>sentimood.js</code> file from the GitHub repository to the desired location in your repository. Once you have done this, you will need to reference the script as follows:</p> 
    <pre><code>&lt;script type="text/javascript" src="your-path/sentimood.js"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;
</code></pre> 
    <p>Once referenced, <code>Sentimood</code> is very intuitive. You can use it as follows:</p> 
    <pre><code>var sentimood = new Sentimood();
var analysis = sentimood.analyze('Node is good');
var positivity = sentimood.positivity('Python is excellent');
var negativity = sentimood.negativity('PHP is bad');
</code></pre> 
    <p>To get to grips with Sentimood, it is actually best to mess around with it in the REPL. To do this, open your REPL by running the <code>node</code> command from your project root. You can then load the contents of <code>sentimood.js</code> into the REPL using:</p> 
    <pre><code>.load components/sentimood/sentimood.js
</code></pre> 
    <p>Your path to <code>sentimood.js</code> may be different if you have different Bower settings, or if you haven't used Bower for installation. One disadvantage of this load method is that it places the code from the <code>sentimood.js</code> file into your Node REPL history so you will not be to access your recent command history (unless you press the up arrow a LOT).</p> 
    <p>Once Sentimood is loaded into your REPL, you can play with it easily. </p> 
    <pre><code>&gt; var sentimood = new Sentimood();
undefined
&gt; sentimood.analyze('Node is good')
the phrase is
Node is good
{ score: 3,
  comparative: NaN,
  positive: 
   { score: 3,
     comparative: 3,
     words: [ 'good' ] },
  negative: { score: 0, comparative: NaN, words: [] } }
&gt; sentimood.analyze('Node is bad')
the phrase is
Node is bad
{ score: -3,
  comparative: NaN,
  positive: { score: 0, comparative: NaN, words: [] },
  negative: 
   { score: 3,
     comparative: 3,
     words: [ 'bad' ] } }
</code></pre> 
    <p>Of course, whenever you use a sentiment analysis tool you always have to understand that it may have limitations. For example, Sentimood struggles as soon as I use a double-negative:</p> 
    <pre><code>&gt; sentimood.analyze('Node is not bad')
the phrase is
Node is not bad
{ score: -3,
  comparative: NaN,
  positive: { score: 0, comparative: NaN, words: [] },
  negative: 
   { score: 3,
     comparative: 3,
     words: [ 'bad' ] } }
</code></pre> 
    <p>That said, Sentimood appears to be the only client-side sentiment analysis NPM package available. I have found it very useful for my work - hopefully you will find it helpful too.</p> 
   </div> 
   <div class="clearfix"> 
   </div> 
   <hr> 
   <footer class="text-center"> 
    <ul> 
     <li><a href="/tech-stack">My Stack</a></li> 
    </ul> 
    <div class="clearfix"></div> 
    <hr> 
    <p>© George Lambert</p> 
   </footer> 
  </div>  
 </body>
</html>
